Patent Information.Patent Title: Antimicrobial Peptides And Methods Of Making And Using Same
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention provides a new methodology combining MD simulations and database-guided high-throughput screening to rationally design pore forming membrane-active peptides. The present inventive methodology is able to allow tuning of a range of structural and functional properties such as pore size and selectively targeting membranes with specific lipid compositions. The present inventive methods will ultimately allow de novo design of membrane-active peptides for a wide range of biomedical applications, including for example, antimicrobial agents.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Enterococcus faecalis (MIC=100 µM), Lactococcus lactis (MIC=100 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Fallaxidin-3.1 shows antibacterial activity against the Gram-positive bacteria.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.

Literature.Title: The fallaxidin peptides from the skin secretion of the Eastern Dwarf Tree Frog Litoria fallax. Sequence determination by positive and negative ion electrospray mass spectrometry antimicrobial activity and cDNA cloning of the fallaxidins.
Literature.Author: Jackway RJ, Bowie JH, Bilusich D, Musgrave IF, Surinya-Johnson KH, Tyler MJ, Eichinger PC.

Literature.Title: The fallaxidin peptides from the skin secretion of the eastern dwarf tree frog Litoria fallax. Sequence determination by positive and negative ion electrospray mass spectrometry: antimicrobial activity and cDNA cloning of the fallaxidins.
